snippet: Jurors have been selected to hear murder charges against David Tarloff, who says he was legally insane when he killed Kathryn Faughey, a Manhattan psychologist, in 2008.
abstract: Jurors are selected to hear murder charges against David Tarloff, accused of killing psychologist Kathryn Faughey in her Upper East Side office in 2008; criminal case has dragged on for five years because Tarloff, who is pleading not guilty by reason of insanity, had previously been declared unfit to stand trial.
lead_paragraph: Jurors have been selected to hear murder charges against David Tarloff, who says he was legally insane when he killed Kathryn Faughey, a Manhattan psychologist, in 2008.

headline.seo: Trial to Begin, Again, 5 Years After Therapist’s Killing
headline.main: Third Attempt at Trial in Killing of a Therapist
headline.print_headline: Third Attempt at Trial In Killing of a Therapist
